page.title: 03WATERWAYS
page.content: The{River Avon}loops through deeply wooded area to east of Bath -one of the most spectacular landscapes in the country.In 1822 a{toll bridge}was built at a cost of Â£4000 to cross from {Bathampton}to{Batheaston.}River once used to carry Bath stone to London, Bristol and other major ports.Today there is good{fishing}and{boating. Residents whose property stretches to its banks have{riparian}rights.Meadows along river prone to flooding in winter but construction of weir in seventies has improved the situation. {Kennet & Avon}Canal,leaving Avon in the city is noted for tench,bream,carp and pike.A beautiful route for {pedestrians}and{pleasure boats}which ply along canal in summer. Interesting industrial archaology including restored{light swing bridge}which holds 3 tons.Current Restoration Fund.
